00020 #ifndef CCN_NAMETREE_DEFINED
00021 #define CCN_NAMETREE_DEFINED
00022 
00023 /**
00024  * A cookie is used as a more ephemeral way of holding a reference to a
00025  * nametree entry, without the danger of an undetected dangling reference
00026  * when the entry is destroyed.  This is useful for internal
00027  * data structures such as queues or enumeration states.
00028  *
00029  * Holding a cookie does not prevent the entry from being
00030  * destroyed, either explicitly or to conserve resources.
00031  *
00032  * The value 0 is used to denote no entry.
00033  */
00034 typedef unsigned ccn_cookie;
00035 
00036 struct ccn_nametree;
00037 struct ccny;
00038 
00039 /**
00040  *  Procedure type for several optional client callbacks.
00041  */
00042 typedef void (*ccn_nametree_action)(struct ccn_nametree *, struct ccny *);
00043 
00044 /**
00045  *  Procedure type for comparison callback used for ordering
00046  *
00047  * The result is tested for negative, zero, or positive,
00048  * meaning less, equal, or greater.
00049  *
00050  * The default is to use ccn_flatname_compare().
00051  */
00052 typedef int (*ccn_nametree_compare)(const unsigned char *, size_t,
00053                                     const unsigned char *, size_t);
00054 
00055 struct ccn_nametree {
00056     int n;                  /**< number of enrolled entries */
00057     int limit;              /**< recommended maximum n */
00058     ccn_cookie cookie;      /**< newest used cookie number */
00059     unsigned cookiemask;    /**< one less than a power of two */
00060     struct ccny **nmentry_by_cookie; /**< for direct lookup by cookie */
00061     struct ccny *head;      /**< head for skiplist, etc. */
00062     void *data;             /**< for client use */
00063     ccn_nametree_compare compare; /**< for comparison */
00064     ccn_nametree_action post_enroll; /**< called after enroll */
00065     ccn_nametree_action pre_remove; /**< called before removal */
00066     ccn_nametree_action check; /**< called to check client structures */
00067     ccn_nametree_action finalize; /**< called from destroy */
00068 };

00126 #ifdef CCN_NAMETREE_IMPL
00127 
00128 /**
00129  *  A nametree entry
00130  *
00131  * The nametree is designed for rapid lookup of data by name prefix.
00132  * This can be useful for keeping track of such things as
00133  * PIT entries, FIB entries, statistics used by the strategy layer,
00134  * name enumeration, and creation/deletion notifications.
00135  *
00136  * To accomplish this, the nametree nodes are linked into several
00137  * data structures.  One of these is a skiplist, so that we can
00138  * quickly access the first node that has a given prefix.  Use of the base
00139  * layer of the skiplist links also allows for rapid forward traversal.
00140  * There is a linked list of the nodes in reverse order, so backward
00141  * traversal and removal is fast as well.
00142  *
00143  * Clients should normally use the procedural interface, so the details
00144  * of struct ccny are only exposed if CCN_NAMETREE_IMPL is defined before
00145  * inclusion of the header file.
00146  *
00147  */
00148 struct ccny {
00149     struct ccny *prev;      /**< link to previous, in name order */
00150     unsigned char *key;     /**< for skiplist, et. al. */
00151     unsigned keylen;        /**< size of key, in bytes */
00152     ccn_cookie cookie;      /**< cookie for this entry */
00153     void *payload;          /**< client payload */
00154     unsigned info;          /**< for client use */
00155     unsigned short prv;     /**< not for client use */
00156     short skipdim;          /**< dimension of skiplinks array */
00157     struct ccny *skiplinks[1]; /**< skiplist links (flex array) */
00158 };
00159 
00160 #endif
